00080 static struct lu_kmem_descr osd_caches[] = {
00081         {
00082                 .ckd_cache = &osd_object_kmem,
00083                 .ckd_name  = "zfs_osd_obj",
00084                 .ckd_size  = sizeof(struct osd_object)
00085         },
00086         {
00087                 .ckd_cache = &osd_zapit_cachep,
00088                 .ckd_name  = "osd_zapit_cache",

00090         },
00091         {
00092                 .ckd_cache = NULL
00093         }

00096 static void arc_prune_func(int64_t bytes, void *private)
00097 {
00098         struct osd_device *od = private;
00099         struct lu_site    *site = &od->od_site;
00100         struct lu_env      env;
00101         int rc;
00102 
00103         rc = lu_env_init(&env, LCT_SHRINKER);
00104         if (rc) {
00105                 CERROR("%s: can't initialize shrinker env: rc = %d\n",
00106                        od->od_svname, rc);
00107                 return;
00108         }
00109 
00110         lu_site_purge(&env, site, (bytes >> 10));
00111 
00112         lu_env_fini(&env);
00113 }

00115 /*
00116  * Concurrency: doesn't access mutable data
00117  */
00118 static int osd_root_get(const struct lu_env *env,
00119                         struct dt_device *dev, struct lu_fid *f)
00120 {
00121         lu_local_obj_fid(f, OSD_FS_ROOT_OID);
00122         return 0;
00123 }

00129 /*
00130  * Concurrency: shouldn't matter.
00131  */
00132 static void osd_trans_commit_cb(void *cb_data, int error)
00133 {
00134         struct osd_thandle      *oh = cb_data;
00135         struct thandle          *th = &oh->ot_super;
00136         struct osd_device       *osd = osd_dt_dev(th->th_dev);
00137         struct lu_device        *lud = &th->th_dev->dd_lu_dev;
00138         struct dt_txn_commit_cb *dcb, *tmp;
00139 
00140         ENTRY;
00141 
00142         if (error) {
00143                 if (error == ECANCELED)
00144                         CWARN("%s: transaction @0x%p was aborted\n",
00145                               osd_dt_dev(th->th_dev)->od_svname, th);
00146                 else
00147                         CERROR("%s: transaction @0x%p commit error: rc = %d\n",
00148                                 osd_dt_dev(th->th_dev)->od_svname, th, error);
00149         }
00150 
00151         dt_txn_hook_commit(th);
00152 
00153         /* call per-transaction callbacks if any */
00154         list_for_each_entry_safe(dcb, tmp, &oh->ot_dcb_list, dcb_linkage)
00155                 dcb->dcb_func(NULL, th, dcb, error);
00156 
00157         /* Unlike ldiskfs, zfs updates space accounting at commit time.
00158          * As a consequence, op_end is called only now to inform the quota slave
00159          * component that reserved quota space is now accounted in usage and
00160          * should be released. Quota space won't be adjusted at this point since
00161          * we can't provide a suitable environment. It will be performed
00162          * asynchronously by a lquota thread. */
00163         qsd_op_end(NULL, osd->od_quota_slave, &oh->ot_quota_trans);
00164 
00165         lu_device_put(lud);
00166         th->th_dev = NULL;
00167         lu_context_exit(&th->th_ctx);
00168         lu_context_fini(&th->th_ctx);
00169         OBD_FREE_PTR(oh);
00170 
00171         EXIT;
00172 }
00173 
00174 static int osd_trans_cb_add(struct thandle *th, struct dt_txn_commit_cb *dcb)
00175 {
00176         struct osd_thandle *oh = container_of0(th, struct osd_thandle,
00177                                                ot_super);
00178 
00179         LASSERT(dcb->dcb_magic == TRANS_COMMIT_CB_MAGIC);
00180         LASSERT(&dcb->dcb_func != NULL);
00181         if (dcb->dcb_flags & DCB_TRANS_STOP)
00182                 list_add(&dcb->dcb_linkage, &oh->ot_stop_dcb_list);
00183         else
00184                 list_add(&dcb->dcb_linkage, &oh->ot_dcb_list);
00185 
00186         return 0;
00187 }
00188 
00189 /*
00190  * Concurrency: shouldn't matter.
00191  */
00192 static int osd_trans_start(const struct lu_env *env, struct dt_device *d,
00193                            struct thandle *th)
00194 {
00195         struct osd_thandle      *oh;
00196         int                     rc;
00197         ENTRY;
00198 
00199         oh = container_of0(th, struct osd_thandle, ot_super);
00200         LASSERT(oh);
00201         LASSERT(oh->ot_tx);
00202 
00203         rc = dt_txn_hook_start(env, d, th);
00204         if (rc != 0)
00205                 RETURN(rc);
00206 
00207         if (oh->ot_write_commit && OBD_FAIL_CHECK(OBD_FAIL_OST_MAPBLK_ENOSPC))
00208                 /* Unlike ldiskfs, ZFS checks for available space and returns
00209                  * -ENOSPC when assigning txg */
00210                 RETURN(-ENOSPC);
00211 
00212         rc = -dmu_tx_assign(oh->ot_tx, TXG_WAIT);
00213         if (unlikely(rc != 0)) {
00214                 struct osd_device *osd = osd_dt_dev(d);
00215                 /* dmu will call commit callback with error code during abort */
00216                 if (!lu_device_is_md(&d->dd_lu_dev) && rc == -ENOSPC)
00217                         CERROR("%s: failed to start transaction due to ENOSPC"
00218                                "\n", osd->od_svname);
00219                 else
00220                         CERROR("%s: can't assign tx: rc = %d\n",
00221                                osd->od_svname, rc);
00222         } else {
00223                 /* add commit callback */
00224                 dmu_tx_callback_register(oh->ot_tx, osd_trans_commit_cb, oh);
00225                 oh->ot_assigned = 1;
00226                 lu_context_init(&th->th_ctx, th->th_tags);
00227                 lu_context_enter(&th->th_ctx);
00228                 lu_device_get(&d->dd_lu_dev);
00229         }
00230 
00231         RETURN(rc);
00232 }
00233 
00234 static int osd_unlinked_object_free(struct osd_device *osd, uint64_t oid);
00235 
00236 static void osd_unlinked_list_emptify(struct osd_device *osd,
00237                                       struct list_head *list, bool free)
00238 {
00239         struct osd_object *obj;
00240         uint64_t           oid;
00241 
00242         while (!list_empty(list)) {
00243                 obj = list_entry(list->next,
00244                                  struct osd_object, oo_unlinked_linkage);
00245                 LASSERT(obj->oo_db != NULL);
00246                 oid = obj->oo_db->db_object;
00247 
00248                 list_del_init(&obj->oo_unlinked_linkage);
00249                 if (free)
00250                         (void)osd_unlinked_object_free(osd, oid);
00251         }
00252 }
00253 
00254 static void osd_trans_stop_cb(struct osd_thandle *oth, int result)
00255 {
00256         struct dt_txn_commit_cb *dcb;
00257         struct dt_txn_commit_cb *tmp;
00258 
00259         /* call per-transaction stop callbacks if any */
00260         list_for_each_entry_safe(dcb, tmp, &oth->ot_stop_dcb_list,
00261                                  dcb_linkage) {
00262                 LASSERTF(dcb->dcb_magic == TRANS_COMMIT_CB_MAGIC,
00263                          "commit callback entry: magic=%x name='%s'\n",
00264                          dcb->dcb_magic, dcb->dcb_name);
00265                 list_del_init(&dcb->dcb_linkage);
00266                 dcb->dcb_func(NULL, &oth->ot_super, dcb, result);
00267         }
00268 }
00269 
00270 /*
00271  * Concurrency: shouldn't matter.
00272  */
00273 static int osd_trans_stop(const struct lu_env *env, struct dt_device *dt,
00274                           struct thandle *th)
00275 {
00276         struct osd_device       *osd = osd_dt_dev(th->th_dev);
00277         bool                     sync = (th->th_sync != 0);
00278         struct osd_thandle      *oh;
00279         struct list_head         unlinked;
00280         uint64_t                 txg;
00281         int                      rc;
00282         ENTRY;
00283 
00284         oh = container_of0(th, struct osd_thandle, ot_super);
00285         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&unlinked);
00286         list_splice_init(&oh->ot_unlinked_list, &unlinked);
00287 
00288         if (oh->ot_assigned == 0) {
00289                 LASSERT(oh->ot_tx);
00290                 dmu_tx_abort(oh->ot_tx);
00291                 osd_object_sa_dirty_rele(oh);
00292                 osd_unlinked_list_emptify(osd, &unlinked, false);
00293                 /* there won't be any commit, release reserved quota space now,
00294                  * if any */
00295                 qsd_op_end(env, osd->od_quota_slave, &oh->ot_quota_trans);
00296                 OBD_FREE_PTR(oh);
00297                 RETURN(0);
00298         }
00299 
00300         /* When doing our own inode accounting, the ZAPs storing per-uid/gid
00301          * usage are updated at operation execution time, so we should call
00302          * qsd_op_end() straight away. Otherwise (for blk accounting maintained
00303          * by ZFS and when #inode is estimated from #blks) accounting is updated
00304          * at commit time and the call to qsd_op_end() must be delayed */
00305         if (oh->ot_quota_trans.lqt_id_cnt > 0 &&
00306                         !oh->ot_quota_trans.lqt_ids[0].lqi_is_blk &&
00307                         !osd->od_quota_iused_est)
00308                 qsd_op_end(env, osd->od_quota_slave, &oh->ot_quota_trans);
00309 
00310         rc = dt_txn_hook_stop(env, th);
00311         if (rc != 0)
00312                 CDEBUG(D_OTHER, "%s: transaction hook failed: rc = %d\n",
00313                        osd->od_svname, rc);
00314 
00315         osd_trans_stop_cb(oh, rc);
00316 
00317         LASSERT(oh->ot_tx);
00318         txg = oh->ot_tx->tx_txg;
00319 
00320         osd_object_sa_dirty_rele(oh);
00321         /* XXX: Once dmu_tx_commit() called, oh/th could have been freed
00322          * by osd_trans_commit_cb already. */
00323         dmu_tx_commit(oh->ot_tx);
00324 
00325         osd_unlinked_list_emptify(osd, &unlinked, true);
00326 
00327         if (sync)
00328                 txg_wait_synced(dmu_objset_pool(osd->od_os), txg);
00329 
00330         RETURN(rc);
00331 }
00332 
00333 static struct thandle *osd_trans_create(const struct lu_env *env,
00334                                         struct dt_device *dt)
00335 {
00336         struct osd_device       *osd = osd_dt_dev(dt);
00337         struct osd_thandle      *oh;
00338         struct thandle          *th;
00339         dmu_tx_t                *tx;
00340         ENTRY;
00341 
00342         tx = dmu_tx_create(osd->od_os);
00343         if (tx == NULL)
00344                 RETURN(ERR_PTR(-ENOMEM));
00345 
00346         /* alloc callback data */
00347         OBD_ALLOC_PTR(oh);
00348         if (oh == NULL) {
00349                 dmu_tx_abort(tx);
00350                 RETURN(ERR_PTR(-ENOMEM));
00351         }
00352 
00353         oh->ot_tx = tx;
00354         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&oh->ot_dcb_list);
00355         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&oh->ot_stop_dcb_list);
00356         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&oh->ot_unlinked_list);
00357         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&oh->ot_sa_list);
00358         sema_init(&oh->ot_sa_lock, 1);
00359         memset(&oh->ot_quota_trans, 0, sizeof(oh->ot_quota_trans));
00360         th = &oh->ot_super;
00361         th->th_dev = dt;
00362         th->th_result = 0;
00363         th->th_tags = LCT_TX_HANDLE;
00364         RETURN(th);
00365 }
00366 
00367 /* Estimate the number of objects from a number of blocks */
00368 uint64_t osd_objs_count_estimate(uint64_t refdbytes, uint64_t usedobjs,
00369                                  uint64_t nrblocks, uint64_t est_maxblockshift)
00370 {
00371         uint64_t est_objs, est_refdblocks, est_usedobjs;
00372 
00373         /* Compute an nrblocks estimate based on the actual number of
00374          * dnodes that could fit in the space.  Since we don't know the
00375          * overhead associated with each dnode (xattrs, SAs, VDEV overhead,
00376          * etc) just using DNODE_SHIFT isn't going to give a good estimate.
00377          * Instead, compute an estimate based on the average space usage per
00378          * dnode, with an upper and lower cap.
00379          *
00380          * In case there aren't many dnodes or blocks used yet, add a small
00381          * correction factor using OSD_DNODE_EST_SHIFT.  This correction
00382          * factor gradually disappears as the number of real dnodes grows.
00383          * This also avoids the need to check for divide-by-zero later.
00384          */
00385         CLASSERT(OSD_DNODE_MIN_BLKSHIFT > 0);
00386         CLASSERT(OSD_DNODE_EST_BLKSHIFT > 0);
00387 
00388         est_refdblocks = (refdbytes >> est_maxblockshift) +
00389                          (OSD_DNODE_EST_COUNT >> OSD_DNODE_EST_BLKSHIFT);
00390         est_usedobjs   = usedobjs + OSD_DNODE_EST_COUNT;
00391 
00392         /* Average space/dnode more than maximum dnode size, use max dnode
00393          * size to estimate free dnodes from adjusted free blocks count.
00394          * OSTs typically use more than one block dnode so this case applies. */
00395         if (est_usedobjs <= est_refdblocks * 2) {
00396                 est_objs = nrblocks;
00397 
00398         /* Average space/dnode smaller than min dnode size (probably due to
00399          * metadnode compression), use min dnode size to estimate the number of
00400          * objects.
00401          * An MDT typically uses below 512 bytes/dnode so this case applies. */
00402         } else if (est_usedobjs >= (est_refdblocks << OSD_DNODE_MIN_BLKSHIFT)) {
00403                 est_objs = nrblocks << OSD_DNODE_MIN_BLKSHIFT;
00404 
00405                 /* Between the extremes, we try to use the average size of
00406                  * existing dnodes to compute the number of dnodes that fit
00407                  * into nrblocks:
00408                  *
00409                  * est_objs = nrblocks * (est_usedobjs / est_refblocks);
00410                  *
00411                  * but this may overflow 64 bits or become 0 if not handled well
00412                  *
00413                  * We know nrblocks is below (64 - 17 = 47) bits from
00414                  * SPA_MAXBLKSHIFT, and est_usedobjs is under 48 bits due to
00415                  * DN_MAX_OBJECT_SHIFT, which means that multiplying them may
00416                  * get as large as 2 ^ 95.
00417                  *
00418                  * We also know (est_usedobjs / est_refdblocks) is between 2 and
00419                  * 256, due to above checks, we can safely compute this first.
00420                  * We care more about accuracy on the MDT (many dnodes/block)
00421                  * which is good because this is where truncation errors are
00422                  * smallest.  This adds 8 bits to nrblocks so we can use 7 bits
00423                  * to compute a fixed-point fraction and nrblocks can still fit
00424                  * in 64 bits. */
00425         } else {
00426                 unsigned dnodes_per_block = (est_usedobjs << 7)/est_refdblocks;
00427 
00428                 est_objs = (nrblocks * dnodes_per_block) >> 7;
00429         }
00430         return est_objs;
00431 }
00432 
00433 static int osd_objset_statfs(struct osd_device *osd, struct obd_statfs *osfs)
00434 {
00435         struct objset *os = osd->od_os;
00436         uint64_t refdbytes, availbytes, usedobjs, availobjs;
00437         uint64_t est_availobjs;
00438         uint64_t reserved;
00439         uint64_t bshift;
00440 
00441         dmu_objset_space(os, &refdbytes, &availbytes, &usedobjs, &availobjs);
00442 
00443         memset(osfs, 0, sizeof(*osfs));
00444 
00445         /* We're a zfs filesystem. */
00446         osfs->os_type = UBERBLOCK_MAGIC;
00447 
00448         /*
00449          * ZFS allows multiple block sizes.  For statfs, Linux makes no
00450          * proper distinction between bsize and frsize.  For calculations
00451          * of free and used blocks incorrectly uses bsize instead of frsize,
00452          * but bsize is also used as the optimal blocksize.  We return the
00453          * largest possible block size as IO size for the optimum performance
00454          * and scale the free and used blocks count appropriately.
00455          */
00456         osfs->os_bsize = osd->od_max_blksz;
00457         bshift = fls64(osfs->os_bsize) - 1;
00458 
00459         osfs->os_blocks = (refdbytes + availbytes) >> bshift;
00460         osfs->os_bfree = availbytes >> bshift;
00461         osfs->os_bavail = osfs->os_bfree; /* no extra root reservation */
00462 
00463         /* Take replication (i.e. number of copies) into account */
00464         osfs->os_bavail /= os->os_copies;
00465 
00466         /*
00467          * Reserve some space so we don't run into ENOSPC due to grants not
00468          * accounting for metadata overhead in ZFS, and to avoid fragmentation.
00469          * Rather than report this via os_bavail (which makes users unhappy if
00470          * they can't fill the filesystem 100%), reduce os_blocks as well.
00471          *
00472          * Reserve 0.78% of total space, at least 16MB for small filesystems,
00473          * for internal files to be created/unlinked when space is tight.
00474          */
00475         CLASSERT(OSD_STATFS_RESERVED_SIZE > 0);
00476         reserved = OSD_STATFS_RESERVED_SIZE >> bshift;
00477         if (likely(osfs->os_blocks >= reserved << OSD_STATFS_RESERVED_SHIFT))
00478                 reserved = osfs->os_blocks >> OSD_STATFS_RESERVED_SHIFT;
00479 
00480         osfs->os_blocks -= reserved;
00481         osfs->os_bfree  -= min(reserved, osfs->os_bfree);
00482         osfs->os_bavail -= min(reserved, osfs->os_bavail);
00483 
00484         /*
00485          * The availobjs value returned from dmu_objset_space() is largely
00486          * useless, since it reports the number of objects that might
00487          * theoretically still fit into the dataset, independent of minor
00488          * issues like how much space is actually available in the pool.
00489          * Compute a better estimate in udmu_objs_count_estimate().
00490          */
00491         est_availobjs = osd_objs_count_estimate(refdbytes, usedobjs,
00492                                                 osfs->os_bfree, bshift);
00493 
00494         osfs->os_ffree = min(availobjs, est_availobjs);
00495         osfs->os_files = osfs->os_ffree + usedobjs;
00496 
00497         /* ZFS XXX: fill in backing dataset FSID/UUID
00498            memcpy(osfs->os_fsid, .... );*/
00499 
00500         osfs->os_namelen = MAXNAMELEN;
00501         osfs->os_maxbytes = OBD_OBJECT_EOF;
00502 
00503         if (!spa_writeable(dmu_objset_spa(os)) ||
00504             osd->od_dev_set_rdonly || osd->od_prop_rdonly)
00505                 osfs->os_state |= OS_STATE_READONLY;
00506 
00507         return 0;
00508 }
00509 
00510 /*
00511  * Concurrency: shouldn't matter.
00512  */
00513 int osd_statfs(const struct lu_env *env, struct dt_device *d,
00514                struct obd_statfs *osfs)
00515 {
00516         int                rc;
00517         ENTRY;
00518 
00519         rc = osd_objset_statfs(osd_dt_dev(d), osfs);
00520         if (unlikely(rc != 0))
00521                 RETURN(rc);
00522 
00523         osfs->os_bavail -= min_t(u64,
00524                                  OSD_GRANT_FOR_LOCAL_OIDS / osfs->os_bsize,
00525                                  osfs->os_bavail);
00526         RETURN(0);
00527 }
00528 
00529 static int osd_blk_insert_cost(struct osd_device *osd)
00530 {
00531         int max_blockshift, nr_blkptrshift, bshift;
00532 
00533         /* max_blockshift is the log2 of the number of blocks needed to reach
00534          * the maximum filesize (that's to say 2^64) */
00535         bshift = osd_spa_maxblockshift(dmu_objset_spa(osd->od_os));
00536         max_blockshift = DN_MAX_OFFSET_SHIFT - bshift;
00537 
00538         /* nr_blkptrshift is the log2 of the number of block pointers that can
00539          * be stored in an indirect block */
00540         CLASSERT(DN_MAX_INDBLKSHIFT > SPA_BLKPTRSHIFT);
00541         nr_blkptrshift = DN_MAX_INDBLKSHIFT - SPA_BLKPTRSHIFT;
00542 
00543         /* max_blockshift / nr_blkptrshift is thus the maximum depth of the
00544          * tree. We add +1 for rounding purpose.
00545          * The tree depth times the indirect block size gives us the maximum
00546          * cost of inserting a block in the tree */
00547         return (max_blockshift / nr_blkptrshift + 1) * (1<<DN_MAX_INDBLKSHIFT);
00548 }
00549 
00550 /*
00551  * Concurrency: doesn't access mutable data.
00552  */
00553 static void osd_conf_get(const struct lu_env *env,
00554                          const struct dt_device *dev,
00555                          struct dt_device_param *param)
00556 {
00557         struct osd_device *osd = osd_dt_dev(dev);
00558 
00559         /*
00560          * XXX should be taken from not-yet-existing fs abstraction layer.
00561          */
00562         param->ddp_max_name_len = MAXNAMELEN;
00563         param->ddp_max_nlink    = 1 << 31; /* it's 8byte on a disk */
00564         param->ddp_symlink_max  = PATH_MAX;
00565         param->ddp_mount_type   = LDD_MT_ZFS;
00566 
00567         param->ddp_mntopts      = MNTOPT_USERXATTR;
00568         if (osd->od_posix_acl)
00569                 param->ddp_mntopts |= MNTOPT_ACL;
00570         param->ddp_max_ea_size  = DXATTR_MAX_ENTRY_SIZE;
00571 
00572         /* for maxbytes, report same value as ZPL */
00573         param->ddp_maxbytes     = MAX_LFS_FILESIZE;
00574 
00575         /* inodes are dynamically allocated, so we report the per-inode space
00576          * consumption to upper layers. This static value is not really accurate
00577          * and we should use the same logic as in udmu_objset_statfs() to
00578          * estimate the real size consumed by an object */
00579         param->ddp_inodespace = OSD_DNODE_EST_COUNT;
00580         /* Although ZFS isn't an extent-based filesystem, the metadata overhead
00581          * (i.e. 7 levels of indirect blocks, see osd_blk_insert_cost()) should
00582          * not be accounted for every single new block insertion.
00583          * Instead, the maximum extent size is set to the number of blocks that
00584          * can fit into a single contiguous indirect block. There would be some
00585          * cases where this crosses indirect blocks, but it also won't have 7
00586          * new levels of indirect blocks in that case either, so it will still
00587          * have enough reserved space for the extra indirect block */
00588         param->ddp_max_extent_blks =
00589                 (1 << (DN_MAX_INDBLKSHIFT - SPA_BLKPTRSHIFT));
00590         param->ddp_extent_tax = osd_blk_insert_cost(osd);
00591 }
00592 
00593 /*
00594  * Concurrency: shouldn't matter.
00595  */
00596 static int osd_sync(const struct lu_env *env, struct dt_device *d)
00597 {
00598         struct osd_device  *osd = osd_dt_dev(d);
00599         CDEBUG(D_CACHE, "syncing OSD %s\n", LUSTRE_OSD_ZFS_NAME);
00600         txg_wait_synced(dmu_objset_pool(osd->od_os), 0ULL);
00601         CDEBUG(D_CACHE, "synced OSD %s\n", LUSTRE_OSD_ZFS_NAME);
00602         return 0;
00603 }
00604 
00605 static int osd_commit_async(const struct lu_env *env, struct dt_device *dev)
00606 {
00607         struct osd_device *osd = osd_dt_dev(dev);
00608         tx_state_t        *tx = &dmu_objset_pool(osd->od_os)->dp_tx;
00609         uint64_t           txg;
00610 
00611         mutex_enter(&tx->tx_sync_lock);
00612         txg = tx->tx_open_txg + 1;
00613         if (tx->tx_quiesce_txg_waiting < txg) {
00614                 tx->tx_quiesce_txg_waiting = txg;
00615                 cv_broadcast(&tx->tx_quiesce_more_cv);
00616         }
00617         mutex_exit(&tx->tx_sync_lock);
00618 
00619         return 0;
00620 }
00621 
00622 /*
00623  * Concurrency: shouldn't matter.
00624  */
00625 static int osd_ro(const struct lu_env *env, struct dt_device *d)
00626 {
00627         struct osd_device  *osd = osd_dt_dev(d);
00628         ENTRY;
00629 
00630         CERROR("%s: *** setting device %s read-only ***\n",
00631                osd->od_svname, LUSTRE_OSD_ZFS_NAME);
00632         osd->od_dev_set_rdonly = 1;
00633         spa_freeze(dmu_objset_spa(osd->od_os));
00634 
00635         RETURN(0);
00636 }
00637 
00638 static struct dt_device_operations osd_dt_ops = {
00639         .dt_root_get            = osd_root_get,
00640         .dt_statfs              = osd_statfs,
00641         .dt_trans_create        = osd_trans_create,
00642         .dt_trans_start         = osd_trans_start,
00643         .dt_trans_stop          = osd_trans_stop,
00644         .dt_trans_cb_add        = osd_trans_cb_add,
00645         .dt_conf_get            = osd_conf_get,
00646         .dt_sync                = osd_sync,
00647         .dt_commit_async        = osd_commit_async,
00648         .dt_ro                  = osd_ro,
00649 };
00650 
00651 /*
00652  * DMU OSD device type methods
00653  */
00654 static int osd_type_init(struct lu_device_type *t)
00655 {
00656         LU_CONTEXT_KEY_INIT(&osd_key);
00657         return lu_context_key_register(&osd_key);
00658 }
00659 
00660 static void osd_type_fini(struct lu_device_type *t)
00661 {
00662         lu_context_key_degister(&osd_key);
00663 }
00664 
00665 static void *osd_key_init(const struct lu_context *ctx,
00666                           struct lu_context_key *key)
00667 {
00668         struct osd_thread_info *info;
00669 
00670         OBD_ALLOC_PTR(info);
00671         if (info != NULL)
00672                 info->oti_env = container_of(ctx, struct lu_env, le_ctx);
00673         else
00674                 info = ERR_PTR(-ENOMEM);
00675         return info;
00676 }
00677 
00678 static void osd_key_fini(const struct lu_context *ctx,
00679                          struct lu_context_key *key, void *data)
00680 {
00681         struct osd_thread_info *info = data;
00682 
00683         OBD_FREE_PTR(info);
00684 }
00685 
00686 static void osd_key_exit(const struct lu_context *ctx,
00687                          struct lu_context_key *key, void *data)
00688 {
00689         struct osd_thread_info *info = data;
00690 
00691         memset(info, 0, sizeof(*info));
00692 }
00693 
00694 struct lu_context_key osd_key = {
00695         .lct_tags = LCT_DT_THREAD | LCT_MD_THREAD | LCT_MG_THREAD | LCT_LOCAL,
00696         .lct_init = osd_key_init,
00697         .lct_fini = osd_key_fini,
00698         .lct_exit = osd_key_exit
00699 };
00700 
00701 static void osd_fid_fini(const struct lu_env *env, struct osd_device *osd)
00702 {
00703         if (osd->od_cl_seq == NULL)
00704                 return;
00705 
00706         seq_client_fini(osd->od_cl_seq);
00707         OBD_FREE_PTR(osd->od_cl_seq);
00708         osd->od_cl_seq = NULL;
00709 }
00710 
00711 static int osd_shutdown(const struct lu_env *env, struct osd_device *o)
00712 {
00713         ENTRY;
00714 
00715         /* shutdown quota slave instance associated with the device */
00716         if (o->od_quota_slave != NULL) {
00717                 qsd_fini(env, o->od_quota_slave);
00718                 o->od_quota_slave = NULL;
00719         }
00720 
00721         osd_fid_fini(env, o);
00722 
00723         RETURN(0);
00724 }
00725 
00726 static void osd_xattr_changed_cb(void *arg, uint64_t newval)
00727 {
00728         struct osd_device *osd = arg;
00729 
00730         osd->od_xattr_in_sa = (newval == ZFS_XATTR_SA);
00731 }
00732 
00733 static void osd_recordsize_changed_cb(void *arg, uint64_t newval)
00734 {
00735         struct osd_device *osd = arg;
00736 
00737         LASSERT(newval <= osd_spa_maxblocksize(dmu_objset_spa(osd->od_os)));
00738         LASSERT(newval >= SPA_MINBLOCKSIZE);
00739         LASSERT(ISP2(newval));
00740 
00741         osd->od_max_blksz = newval;
00742 }
00743 
00744 static void osd_readonly_changed_cb(void *arg, uint64_t newval)
00745 {
00746         struct osd_device *osd = arg;
00747 
00748         osd->od_prop_rdonly = !!newval;
00749 }
00750 
00751 /*
00752  * This function unregisters all registered callbacks.  It's harmless to
00753  * unregister callbacks that were never registered so it is used to safely
00754  * unwind a partially completed call to osd_objset_register_callbacks().
00755  */
00756 static void osd_objset_unregister_callbacks(struct osd_device *o)
00757 {
00758         struct dsl_dataset      *ds = dmu_objset_ds(o->od_os);
00759 
00760         (void) dsl_prop_unregister(ds, zfs_prop_to_name(ZFS_PROP_XATTR),
00761                                    osd_xattr_changed_cb, o);
00762         (void) dsl_prop_unregister(ds, zfs_prop_to_name(ZFS_PROP_RECORDSIZE),
00763                                    osd_recordsize_changed_cb, o);
00764         (void) dsl_prop_unregister(ds, zfs_prop_to_name(ZFS_PROP_READONLY),
00765                                    osd_readonly_changed_cb, o);
00766 
00767         if (o->arc_prune_cb != NULL) {
00768                 arc_remove_prune_callback(o->arc_prune_cb);
00769                 o->arc_prune_cb = NULL;
00770         }
00771 }
00772 
00773 /*
00774  * Register the required callbacks to be notified when zfs properties
00775  * are modified using the 'zfs(8)' command line utility.
00776  */
00777 static int osd_objset_register_callbacks(struct osd_device *o)
00778 {
00779         struct dsl_dataset      *ds = dmu_objset_ds(o->od_os);
00780         dsl_pool_t              *dp = dmu_objset_pool(o->od_os);
00781         int                     rc;
00782 
00783         LASSERT(ds);
00784         LASSERT(dp);
00785 
00786         dsl_pool_config_enter(dp, FTAG);
00787         rc = -dsl_prop_register(ds, zfs_prop_to_name(ZFS_PROP_XATTR),
00788                                 osd_xattr_changed_cb, o);
00789         if (rc)
00790                 GOTO(err, rc);
00791 
00792         rc = -dsl_prop_register(ds, zfs_prop_to_name(ZFS_PROP_RECORDSIZE),
00793                                 osd_recordsize_changed_cb, o);
00794         if (rc)
00795                 GOTO(err, rc);
00796 
00797         rc = -dsl_prop_register(ds, zfs_prop_to_name(ZFS_PROP_READONLY),
00798                                 osd_readonly_changed_cb, o);
00799         if (rc)
00800                 GOTO(err, rc);
00801 
00802         o->arc_prune_cb = arc_add_prune_callback(arc_prune_func, o);
00803 err:
00804         dsl_pool_config_exit(dp, FTAG);
00805         if (rc)
00806                 osd_objset_unregister_callbacks(o);
00807 
00808         RETURN(rc);
00809 }
00810 
00811 static int osd_objset_open(struct osd_device *o)
00812 {
00813         uint64_t        version = ZPL_VERSION;
00814         uint64_t        sa_obj;
00815         int             rc;
00816         ENTRY;
00817 
00818         rc = -dmu_objset_own(o->od_mntdev, DMU_OST_ZFS, B_FALSE, o, &o->od_os);
00819         if (rc) {
00820                 o->od_os = NULL;
00821                 goto out;
00822         }
00823 
00824         /* Check ZFS version */
00825         rc = -zap_lookup(o->od_os, MASTER_NODE_OBJ,
00826                          ZPL_VERSION_STR, 8, 1, &version);
00827         if (rc) {
00828                 CERROR("%s: Error looking up ZPL VERSION\n", o->od_mntdev);
00829                 /*
00830                  * We can't return ENOENT because that would mean the objset
00831                  * didn't exist.
00832                  */
00833                 GOTO(out, rc = -EIO);
00834         }
00835 
00836         rc = -zap_lookup(o->od_os, MASTER_NODE_OBJ,
00837                          ZFS_SA_ATTRS, 8, 1, &sa_obj);
00838         if (rc)
00839                 GOTO(out, rc);
00840 
00841         rc = -sa_setup(o->od_os, sa_obj, zfs_attr_table,
00842                        ZPL_END, &o->z_attr_table);
00843         if (rc)
00844                 GOTO(out, rc);
00845 
00846         rc = -zap_lookup(o->od_os, MASTER_NODE_OBJ, ZFS_ROOT_OBJ,
00847                          8, 1, &o->od_rootid);
00848         if (rc) {
00849                 CERROR("%s: lookup for root failed: rc = %d\n",
00850                         o->od_svname, rc);
00851                 GOTO(out, rc);
00852         }
00853 
00854         rc = -zap_lookup(o->od_os, MASTER_NODE_OBJ, ZFS_UNLINKED_SET,
00855                          8, 1, &o->od_unlinkedid);
00856         if (rc) {
00857                 CERROR("%s: lookup for %s failed: rc = %d\n",
00858                        o->od_svname, ZFS_UNLINKED_SET, rc);
00859                 GOTO(out, rc);
00860         }
00861 
00862         /* Check that user/group usage tracking is supported */
00863         if (!dmu_objset_userused_enabled(o->od_os) ||
00864             DMU_USERUSED_DNODE(o->od_os)->dn_type != DMU_OT_USERGROUP_USED ||
00865             DMU_GROUPUSED_DNODE(o->od_os)->dn_type != DMU_OT_USERGROUP_USED) {
00866                 CERROR("%s: Space accounting not supported by this target, "
00867                         "aborting\n", o->od_svname);
00868                 GOTO(out, -ENOTSUPP);
00869         }
00870 
00871 out:
00872         if (rc != 0 && o->od_os != NULL) {
00873                 dmu_objset_disown(o->od_os, o);
00874                 o->od_os = NULL;
00875         }
00876 
00877         RETURN(rc);
00878 }
00879 
00880 static int
00881 osd_unlinked_object_free(struct osd_device *osd, uint64_t oid)
00882 {
00883         int       rc;
00884         dmu_tx_t *tx;
00885 
00886         rc = -dmu_free_long_range(osd->od_os, oid, 0, DMU_OBJECT_END);
00887         if (rc != 0) {
00888                 CWARN("%s: Cannot truncate "LPU64": rc = %d\n",
00889                       osd->od_svname, oid, rc);
00890                 return rc;
00891         }
00892 
00893         tx = dmu_tx_create(osd->od_os);
00894         dmu_tx_hold_free(tx, oid, 0, DMU_OBJECT_END);
00895         dmu_tx_hold_zap(tx, osd->od_unlinkedid, FALSE, NULL);
00896         rc = -dmu_tx_assign(tx, TXG_WAIT);
00897         if (rc != 0) {
00898                 CWARN("%s: Cannot assign tx for "LPU64": rc = %d\n",
00899                       osd->od_svname, oid, rc);
00900                 goto failed;
00901         }
00902 
00903         rc = -zap_remove_int(osd->od_os, osd->od_unlinkedid, oid, tx);
00904         if (rc != 0) {
00905                 CWARN("%s: Cannot remove "LPU64" from unlinked set: rc = %d\n",
00906                       osd->od_svname, oid, rc);
00907                 goto failed;
00908         }
00909 
00910         rc = -dmu_object_free(osd->od_os, oid, tx);
00911         if (rc != 0) {
00912                 CWARN("%s: Cannot free "LPU64": rc = %d\n",
00913                       osd->od_svname, oid, rc);
00914                 goto failed;
00915         }
00916         dmu_tx_commit(tx);
00917 
00918         return 0;
00919 
00920 failed:
00921         LASSERT(rc != 0);
00922         dmu_tx_abort(tx);
00923 
00924         return rc;
00925 }
00926 
00927 static void
00928 osd_unlinked_drain(const struct lu_env *env, struct osd_device *osd)
00929 {
00930         zap_cursor_t     zc;
00931         zap_attribute_t *za = &osd_oti_get(env)->oti_za;
00932 
00933         zap_cursor_init(&zc, osd->od_os, osd->od_unlinkedid);
00934 
00935         while (zap_cursor_retrieve(&zc, za) == 0) {
00936                 /* If cannot free the object, leave it in the unlinked set,
00937                  * until the OSD is mounted again when obd_unlinked_drain()
00938                  * will be called. */
00939                 if (osd_unlinked_object_free(osd, za->za_first_integer) != 0)
00940                         break;
00941                 zap_cursor_advance(&zc);
00942         }
00943 
00944         zap_cursor_fini(&zc);
00945 }
00946 
00947 static int osd_mount(const struct lu_env *env,
00948                      struct osd_device *o, struct lustre_cfg *cfg)
00949 {
00950         char                    *mntdev = lustre_cfg_string(cfg, 1);
00951         char                    *svname = lustre_cfg_string(cfg, 4);
00952         dmu_buf_t               *rootdb;
00953         const char              *opts;
00954         int                      rc;
00955         ENTRY;
00956 
00957         if (o->od_os != NULL)
00958                 RETURN(0);
00959 
00960         if (mntdev == NULL || svname == NULL)
00961                 RETURN(-EINVAL);
00962 
00963         rc = strlcpy(o->od_mntdev, mntdev, sizeof(o->od_mntdev));
00964         if (rc >= sizeof(o->od_mntdev))
00965                 RETURN(-E2BIG);
00966 
00967         rc = strlcpy(o->od_svname, svname, sizeof(o->od_svname));
00968         if (rc >= sizeof(o->od_svname))
00969                 RETURN(-E2BIG);
00970 
00971         if (server_name_is_ost(o->od_svname))
00972                 o->od_is_ost = 1;
00973 
00974         rc = osd_objset_open(o);
00975         if (rc)
00976                 GOTO(err, rc);
00977 
00978         o->od_xattr_in_sa = B_TRUE;
00979         o->od_max_blksz = SPA_OLD_MAXBLOCKSIZE;
00980 
00981         rc = osd_objset_register_callbacks(o);
00982         if (rc)
00983                 GOTO(err, rc);
00984 
00985         rc = __osd_obj2dbuf(env, o->od_os, o->od_rootid, &rootdb);
00986         if (rc)
00987                 GOTO(err, rc);
00988 
00989         o->od_root = rootdb->db_object;
00990         sa_buf_rele(rootdb, osd_obj_tag);
00991 
00992         /* 1. initialize oi before any file create or file open */
00993         rc = osd_oi_init(env, o);
00994         if (rc)
00995                 GOTO(err, rc);
00996 
00997         rc = lu_site_init(&o->od_site, osd2lu_dev(o));
00998         if (rc)
00999                 GOTO(err, rc);
01000         o->od_site.ls_bottom_dev = osd2lu_dev(o);
01001 
01002         rc = lu_site_init_finish(&o->od_site);
01003         if (rc)
01004                 GOTO(err, rc);
01005 
01006         /* Use our own ZAP for inode accounting by default, this can be changed
01007          * via procfs to estimate the inode usage from the block usage */
01008         o->od_quota_iused_est = 0;
01009 
01010         rc = osd_procfs_init(o, o->od_svname);
01011         if (rc)
01012                 GOTO(err, rc);
01013 
01014         /* initialize quota slave instance */
01015         o->od_quota_slave = qsd_init(env, o->od_svname, &o->od_dt_dev,
01016                                      o->od_proc_entry);
01017         if (IS_ERR(o->od_quota_slave)) {
01018                 rc = PTR_ERR(o->od_quota_slave);
01019                 o->od_quota_slave = NULL;
01020                 GOTO(err, rc);
01021         }
01022 
01023         /* parse mount option "noacl", and enable ACL by default */
01024         opts = lustre_cfg_string(cfg, 3);
01025         if (opts == NULL || strstr(opts, "noacl") == NULL)
01026                 o->od_posix_acl = 1;
01027 
01028         osd_unlinked_drain(env, o);
01029 err:
01030         if (rc) {
01031                 if (o->od_os)
01032                         dmu_objset_disown(o->od_os, o);
01033                 o->od_os = NULL;
01034         }
01035 
01036         RETURN(rc);
01037 }
01038 
01039 static void osd_umount(const struct lu_env *env, struct osd_device *o)
01040 {
01041         ENTRY;
01042 
01043         if (atomic_read(&o->od_zerocopy_alloc))
01044                 CERROR("%s: lost %d allocated page(s)\n", o->od_svname,
01045                        atomic_read(&o->od_zerocopy_alloc));
01046         if (atomic_read(&o->od_zerocopy_loan))
01047                 CERROR("%s: lost %d loaned abuf(s)\n", o->od_svname,
01048                        atomic_read(&o->od_zerocopy_loan));
01049         if (atomic_read(&o->od_zerocopy_pin))
01050                 CERROR("%s: lost %d pinned dbuf(s)\n", o->od_svname,
01051                        atomic_read(&o->od_zerocopy_pin));
01052 
01053         if (o->od_os != NULL) {
01054                 /* force a txg sync to get all commit callbacks */
01055                 txg_wait_synced(dmu_objset_pool(o->od_os), 0ULL);
01056 
01057                 /* close the object set */
01058                 dmu_objset_disown(o->od_os, o);
01059 
01060                 o->od_os = NULL;
01061         }
01062 
01063         EXIT;
01064 }
01065 
01066 static int osd_device_init0(const struct lu_env *env,
01067                             struct osd_device *o,
01068                             struct lustre_cfg *cfg)
01069 {
01070         struct lu_device        *l = osd2lu_dev(o);
01071         int                      rc;
01072 
01073         /* if the module was re-loaded, env can loose its keys */
01074         rc = lu_env_refill((struct lu_env *) env);
01075         if (rc)
01076                 GOTO(out, rc);
01077 
01078         l->ld_ops = &osd_lu_ops;
01079         o->od_dt_dev.dd_ops = &osd_dt_ops;
01080 
01081 out:
01082         RETURN(rc);
01083 }
01084 
01085 static struct lu_device *osd_device_fini(const struct lu_env *env,
01086                                          struct lu_device *dev);
01087 
01088 static struct lu_device *osd_device_alloc(const struct lu_env *env,
01089                                           struct lu_device_type *type,
01090                                           struct lustre_cfg *cfg)
01091 {
01092         struct osd_device *dev;
01093         int                rc;
01094 
01095         OBD_ALLOC_PTR(dev);
01096         if (dev == NULL)
01097                 return ERR_PTR(-ENOMEM);
01098 
01099         rc = dt_device_init(&dev->od_dt_dev, type);
01100         if (rc == 0) {
01101                 rc = osd_device_init0(env, dev, cfg);
01102                 if (rc == 0) {
01103                         rc = osd_mount(env, dev, cfg);
01104                         if (rc)
01105                                 osd_device_fini(env, osd2lu_dev(dev));
01106                 }
01107                 if (rc)
01108                         dt_device_fini(&dev->od_dt_dev);
01109         }
01110 
01111         if (unlikely(rc != 0))
01112                 OBD_FREE_PTR(dev);
01113 
01114         return rc == 0 ? osd2lu_dev(dev) : ERR_PTR(rc);
01115 }
01116 
01117 static struct lu_device *osd_device_free(const struct lu_env *env,
01118                                          struct lu_device *d)
01119 {
01120         struct osd_device *o = osd_dev(d);
01121         ENTRY;
01122 
01123         /* XXX: make osd top device in order to release reference */
01124         d->ld_site->ls_top_dev = d;
01125         lu_site_purge(env, d->ld_site, -1);
01126         if (!cfs_hash_is_empty(d->ld_site->ls_obj_hash)) {
01127                 LIBCFS_DEBUG_MSG_DATA_DECL(msgdata, D_ERROR, NULL);
01128                 lu_site_print(env, d->ld_site, &msgdata, lu_cdebug_printer);
01129         }
01130         lu_site_fini(&o->od_site);
01131         dt_device_fini(&o->od_dt_dev);
01132         OBD_FREE_PTR(o);
01133 
01134         RETURN (NULL);
01135 }
01136 
01137 static struct lu_device *osd_device_fini(const struct lu_env *env,
01138                                          struct lu_device *d)
01139 {
01140         struct osd_device *o = osd_dev(d);
01141         int                rc;
01142         ENTRY;
01143 
01144 
01145         osd_shutdown(env, o);
01146         osd_oi_fini(env, o);
01147 
01148         if (o->od_os) {
01149                 osd_objset_unregister_callbacks(o);
01150                 osd_sync(env, lu2dt_dev(d));
01151                 txg_wait_callbacks(spa_get_dsl(dmu_objset_spa(o->od_os)));
01152         }
01153 
01154         rc = osd_procfs_fini(o);
01155         if (rc) {
01156                 CERROR("proc fini error %d\n", rc);
01157                 RETURN(ERR_PTR(rc));
01158         }
01159 
01160         if (o->od_os)
01161                 osd_umount(env, o);
01162 
01163         RETURN(NULL);
01164 }
01165 
01166 static int osd_device_init(const struct lu_env *env, struct lu_device *d,
01167                            const char *name, struct lu_device *next)
01168 {
01169         return 0;
01170 }
01171 
01172 /*
01173  * To be removed, setup is performed by osd_device_{init,alloc} and
01174  * cleanup is performed by osd_device_{fini,free).
01175  */
01176 static int osd_process_config(const struct lu_env *env,
01177                               struct lu_device *d, struct lustre_cfg *cfg)
01178 {
01179         struct osd_device       *o = osd_dev(d);
01180         int                     rc;
01181         ENTRY;
01182 
01183         switch(cfg->lcfg_command) {
01184         case LCFG_SETUP:
01185                 rc = osd_mount(env, o, cfg);
01186                 break;
01187         case LCFG_CLEANUP:
01188                 rc = osd_shutdown(env, o);
01189                 break;
01190         case LCFG_PARAM: {
01191                 LASSERT(&o->od_dt_dev);
01192                 rc = class_process_proc_param(PARAM_OSD, lprocfs_osd_obd_vars,
01193                                               cfg, &o->od_dt_dev);
01194                 if (rc > 0 || rc == -ENOSYS)
01195                         rc = class_process_proc_param(PARAM_OST,
01196                                                       lprocfs_osd_obd_vars,
01197                                                       cfg, &o->od_dt_dev);
01198                 break;
01199         }
01200         default:
01201                 rc = -ENOTTY;
01202         }
01203 
01204         RETURN(rc);
01205 }
01206 
01207 static int osd_recovery_complete(const struct lu_env *env, struct lu_device *d)
01208 {
01209         struct osd_device       *osd = osd_dev(d);
01210         int                      rc = 0;
01211         ENTRY;
01212 
01213         if (osd->od_quota_slave == NULL)
01214                 RETURN(0);
01215 
01216         /* start qsd instance on recovery completion, this notifies the quota
01217          * slave code that we are about to process new requests now */
01218         rc = qsd_start(env, osd->od_quota_slave);
01219         RETURN(rc);
01220 }
01221 
01222 /*
01223  * we use exports to track all osd users
01224  */
01225 static int osd_obd_connect(const struct lu_env *env, struct obd_export **exp,
01226                            struct obd_device *obd, struct obd_uuid *cluuid,
01227                            struct obd_connect_data *data, void *localdata)
01228 {
01229         struct osd_device    *osd = osd_dev(obd->obd_lu_dev);
01230         struct lustre_handle  conn;
01231         int                   rc;
01232         ENTRY;
01233 
01234         CDEBUG(D_CONFIG, "connect #%d\n", osd->od_connects);
01235 
01236         rc = class_connect(&conn, obd, cluuid);
01237         if (rc)
01238                 RETURN(rc);
01239 
01240         *exp = class_conn2export(&conn);
01241 
01242         spin_lock(&obd->obd_dev_lock);
01243         osd->od_connects++;
01244         spin_unlock(&obd->obd_dev_lock);
01245 
01246         RETURN(0);
01247 }
01248 
01249 /*
01250  * once last export (we don't count self-export) disappeared
01251  * osd can be released
01252  */
01253 static int osd_obd_disconnect(struct obd_export *exp)
01254 {
01255         struct obd_device *obd = exp->exp_obd;
01256         struct osd_device *osd = osd_dev(obd->obd_lu_dev);
01257         int                rc, release = 0;
01258         ENTRY;
01259 
01260         /* Only disconnect the underlying layers on the final disconnect. */
01261         spin_lock(&obd->obd_dev_lock);
01262         osd->od_connects--;
01263         if (osd->od_connects == 0)
01264                 release = 1;
01265         spin_unlock(&obd->obd_dev_lock);
01266 
01267         rc = class_disconnect(exp); /* bz 9811 */
01268 
01269         if (rc == 0 && release)
01270                 class_manual_cleanup(obd);
01271         RETURN(rc);
01272 }
01273 
01274 static int osd_fid_init(const struct lu_env *env, struct osd_device *osd)
01275 {
01276         struct seq_server_site  *ss = osd_seq_site(osd);
01277         int                     rc;
01278         ENTRY;
01279 
01280         if (osd->od_is_ost || osd->od_cl_seq != NULL)
01281                 RETURN(0);
01282 
01283         if (unlikely(ss == NULL))
01284                 RETURN(-ENODEV);
01285 
01286         OBD_ALLOC_PTR(osd->od_cl_seq);
01287         if (osd->od_cl_seq == NULL)
01288                 RETURN(-ENOMEM);
01289 
01290         rc = seq_client_init(osd->od_cl_seq, NULL, LUSTRE_SEQ_METADATA,
01291                              osd->od_svname, ss->ss_server_seq);
01292 
01293         if (rc != 0) {
01294                 OBD_FREE_PTR(osd->od_cl_seq);
01295                 osd->od_cl_seq = NULL;
01296         }
01297 
01298         RETURN(rc);
01299 }
01300 
01301 static int osd_prepare(const struct lu_env *env, struct lu_device *pdev,
01302                        struct lu_device *dev)
01303 {
01304         struct osd_device       *osd = osd_dev(dev);
01305         int                      rc = 0;
01306         ENTRY;
01307 
01308         if (osd->od_quota_slave != NULL) {
01309                 /* set up quota slave objects */
01310                 rc = qsd_prepare(env, osd->od_quota_slave);
01311                 if (rc != 0)
01312                         RETURN(rc);
01313         }
01314 
01315         rc = osd_fid_init(env, osd);
01316 
01317         RETURN(rc);
01318 }
01319 
01320 struct lu_device_operations osd_lu_ops = {
01321         .ldo_object_alloc       = osd_object_alloc,
01322         .ldo_process_config     = osd_process_config,
01323         .ldo_recovery_complete  = osd_recovery_complete,
01324         .ldo_prepare            = osd_prepare,
01325 };

01333 }
01334 
01335 int osd_fid_alloc(const struct lu_env *env, struct obd_export *exp,
01336                   struct lu_fid *fid, struct md_op_data *op_data)
01337 {
01338         struct osd_device *osd = osd_dev(exp->exp_obd->obd_lu_dev);
01339 
01340         return seq_client_alloc_fid(env, osd->od_cl_seq, fid);
01341 }

01344         .ldto_init              = osd_type_init,
01345         .ldto_fini              = osd_type_fini,

01347         .ldto_start             = osd_type_start,
01348         .ldto_stop              = osd_type_stop,

01359         .ldt_name     = LUSTRE_OSD_ZFS_NAME,
01360         .ldt_ops      = &osd_device_type_ops,
01361         .ldt_ctx_tags = LCT_LOCAL

01365 static struct obd_ops osd_obd_device_ops = {
01366         .o_owner       = THIS_MODULE,
01367         .o_connect      = osd_obd_connect,
01368         .o_disconnect   = osd_obd_disconnect,
01369         .o_fid_alloc    = osd_fid_alloc

01371 
01372 static int __init osd_init(void)
01373 {
01374         int rc;
01375 
01376         rc = osd_options_init();
01377         if (rc)
01378                 return rc;
01379 
01380         rc = lu_kmem_init(osd_caches);
01381         if (rc)
01382                 return rc;
01383 
01384         rc = class_register_type(&osd_obd_device_ops, NULL, true, NULL,
01385                                  LUSTRE_OSD_ZFS_NAME, &osd_device_type);
01386         if (rc)
01387                 lu_kmem_fini(osd_caches);
01388         return rc;
01389 }
01390 
01391 static void __exit osd_exit(void)
01392 {
01393         class_unregister_type(LUSTRE_OSD_ZFS_NAME);
01394         lu_kmem_fini(osd_caches);
01395 }

01398 module_param(osd_oi_count, int, 0444);
01399 MODULE_PARM_DESC(osd_oi_count, "Number of Object Index containers to be created, it's only valid for new filesystem.");

01402 MODULE_DESCRIPTION("Lustre Object Storage Device ("LUSTRE_OSD_ZFS_NAME")");
01403 MODULE_VERSION(LUSTRE_VERSION_STRING);
01404 MODULE_LICENSE("GPL");
01405 
01406 module_init(osd_init);
01407 module_exit(osd_exit);
